text: Simple and straight to the point. This place has very tasty sandwiches for very reasonable prices. Service is great and they also sell some grocery items. Why go to subway when you can come here and get really nice sandwiches?

I could eat the Contessa  every.single.day .  And I can't speak for my girlfriend, but if I could - she would say that she could eat the turkey pastrami sandwich  every.single.day .  This place is amazing.  I can't pronounce the name, but it matters 0%.  I honestly think I'm in love with Contessa.

I've lived in the area for about 3 months and I just found this place last weekend (hand smacks forehead, SMH at myself).  Sandwiches are fantastic and the array of supplies here are going to make me the best Italian chef in the building. I can't wait to come back!

Family owned business with some of the best sandwiches in the city. The Italian hot panini is exquisite. Aside from the sandwiches it is also an Italian supermarket/deli with great prices. Best bang for your buck in the city.

I can never eat plain old Subway again. I go here way too often and I only moved here one year ago. The Italian sandwich is where it's at! I think it's about $4 something for a medium size and maybe $5-6 for the large size.

Not a Chicagoan - a Michigander - Giving a generous 4. I was super hungry having spent morning at Midwest Ortho at RUSH getting a cast. The street where this restaurant is on is really chock full of different restaurants. I knew this was a good place because while waiting for wife to come out - a dozen or so policemen went in and out. I got a FRANK - wife got a NADIA (eggplant) - Meat, seasonings,  was great - but bread was average. Not NY Deli quality.  Wife really liked her sandwich. Also bought olives - green and kalamata - both had pits - and overall they were very good - not too salty. Also bought a 5 ft baguette -

I had The Frank and it was great.  The bread was fresh and the sandwich was delicious.  I'm not a fan of basil and was a little worried about ordering it but I'm glad I did.  I couldn't taste it.   The balsamic vinegar with the salty meats were a perfect combo.  I can't wait to try something different.   I'll be back.

Good selection of sandwiches and sides, plus the store for small odds and ends. Great fresh ingredients always make for good food. Prices are good for what you get. Definitely a great Italian deli and worth checking out.
The Frank has to be one of the best subs in chicago. Fresh mozzarella and sun dried tomatoes lightly toasted on fresh bread.
Love this place! Best sandwiches around. The meat is sliced fresh for each sandwich and the bread is delivered fresh daily.

sandwiches, i only get the italian which i find highly tasty.  fresh mozzarella on the weekends, everything you need for a homemade pizza although the frozen pizza crusts i didnt think too fondly of.  otherwise, cheese, sausage, pepperoni, basil pretty much everything you need as far as condiments.

This place is a hidden gem.  My sister,  neice and I just happened to come upon this place when looking for a place that serves brunch. It is a store that caters to Italian  imported wines and products in addition to having an awesome deli.  (I'm in heaven ) This place is a must-go...we had their pannini caprese. Ingredients were fresh and very satisfying.  Check it out if you're ever in the neighborhood.
Omg! Best sandwiches in the city!!!!!  Made to perfection, no additional sides needed but are available! Must eat here for best effect!  The frank is the winner

So many heart eye emojis for this Little Italy gem!!! You REALLY have to experience this place for yourself. Get "the Frank"! It's served just warmed through with the bread toasted. The fresh mozzarella and fresh basil and sun dried tomatoes with all the salty meats makes this absolute perfection.  Aside from their sandwiches, I've also been here for various things from their house made pasta in the freezers, prosciutto, cheeses, and wine. They have many italian specialty grocery items. You could definitely pick up a handful of items to bring home for a delicious pasta feast. I love the basil plants they sell on the sidewalk in early summer. Large and full and inexpensive.  Always friendly and quick service too! This place is a must when you are strolling through Little Italy!
Not sure why this is getting so much praise. Mediocre sandwiches. Wouldn't return. JP's is way better.

It is nice to have a place that serves some fresh delicious subs and also have a grocery store in side.   You can get anything from cheese's to cooking sauses and even meat.   Their sandwiches are really good and the workers over there are really friendly.   They always have someone who will make sure they have your order and it gets prepared within a few minutes, even when busy.  For example, at 12 pm on a Thursday, I ordered their Italian beef.  And there was 3 customers ahead of me.  I got out of the restaurant within 5 minutes of entering.   If you want some dessert, they have sweets and even ice cream over there.  The ice cream is seen right when entering, so if it is a hot day, then it is sure to make it more refreshing.   Quick tip: they have an entrance from the back as well that customers can use.  I always use it since I live in the apartments behind it.  The enterencebis hard to miss since it says "customer enterence" on the back.

This place is the place to go to for a great sandwich and a great price.  Its much better than Subway and a few dollars cheaper too!  And you can stop in and get wine and many other sorts of cookies here.  The quality is great.  They are pretty fast and friendly.  Sundays are generally less crowded and parking is free on Sundays.  I highly recommend.

Best subs in the area! Maybe best (or top 3) in the City. Great Italian sub, as well as all their others... fresh meats, sliced to order. "The Frank" is another one of their delicious sandwiches- try it and you won't be disappointed.  Good prices. Fresh tasty meats. Fresh bread. Can't beat em.

I don't know how I've only been here once, but it was fantastic. I ordered a deli sandwich; put some chips on it and it was to die for. This reminds me, i need to get back here before I start my New Years healthy eating!

We typically go to Bari, JP's or Lucias but decided to try something new since 2 of the 3 are closed Sundays. What a great decision. Located in the middle of little Italy, this place is amazing.  We got 3 sandwiches (prosciutto, meatball, turkey) and all were delicious. I love how they make them there on the spot and you can customize what you do/don't want. I love how they have an olive bar, cheese, deli, frozen pasta, etc.  Great option for Italian subs, especially on a Sunday when most places are closed.

This is the best business in my neighborhood and i refuse to move because I can get from my living room to Conte Di Savoia in 300 seconds.  They have the finest Italian groceries. They have an OLIVE BAR. They have OCTOPUS SALAD. They have that bread you use for Paninis (pardon my ignorance) and a vast selection of wine and cheese. I really enjoy their coffee too and in the summer they make some delicious gelato. HOWEVER, they also have a deli. And this is where it gets good. This place makes the finest subs in the city, I promise you. Their bread is fresh, their meats are in perfect condition and are served generously in the sandwich. Provolone cheese, oil, vinegar, mustard, mayo, your choice of meat - done right - is a rare pleasure of life. Conte will not disappoint you.. or the sandwich is on me. I live around the corner. PS: Check out their freezer. They have homemade lasagnas, pastas, pizzas and sauces!
Great little Italian deli. Good selection. In and out quickly and well priced given the neighborhood.
The Italian cookies by the pound are spectacular. Great selection of imported specialty pastas, sauces, condiments. Freezer has frozen hand-made pastas.

Best Subs anywhere PERIOD.  My only complaint is that it's so good and only in the city so many in the suburbs will never know what a real sub sandwich should taste like. They offer many other things that are equally as good along with very friendly good people to help ya out.
Ask for the home made fresh mozzarella on Saturdays and Sundays. Great sandwiches. My wife calls the place her wine cellar
Amizing shop!! The food is so good .. And the people over there are so nice U dont have to fly to italia .. Its here in Chicago
Unreal sleeper here ! First the prices are super fair ! The staff is extremely friendly and the quality of the food is top shelf !! Way to go folks ! I will definitely be back !!!

This is what makes neighborhoods so special. Family run indépendant quality beyond what a big super market could give. Fresh mozzarella, ricotta. home-made sauces, pasta in the frozen section. Great homemade gluten free pastas  fresh sausage. Bottle of wine. Badda bing badda boo. Sometimes I just got in for a fresh motz sanwhich. Also got some grocery. I have also used them for catering. It makes me happy walking in the door.

I work in the area and have been coming here for years but haven't been in a while until today.  I forgot how good their sandwiches are...well worth the wait during the busy lunch hour.  Got 'The Frank' today....it was as amazing as I remember:  toasted ham, salami, capocollo, heaps of fresh mozzarella, fresh tomato, sun-dried tomato, fresh chopped basil, and balsamic vinegar...and to top it all off it's just slightly toasted.  Staff are friendly and good hard-working folks.
Great sandwiches, the grocery items are a little pricey though. FYI there is additional parking in the back.
While a family member was in the hospital for a month, we found this deli. Needless to say, we quickly became fans.  Fresh sandwiches and great people.  I recommend "The Contessa"

I had the best sandwich of my life here. From the outside it doesn't look like much but once you take a bite out of one of their sandwiches you'll be hooked. I had the Italian panini - the meat was so soft, the cheese melted perfectly, the bread toasty just right and the sandwich had the right amount of seasoning and oil. It's a really great deli and great spot for lunch.
got squid ink pasta fpr 5.99. cheaper than Eataly for sure!

This is our first time here as we live in Indiana but came up to the hospital.  Very good sandwiches! They even made aa grilled cheese not on the menu for my daughter.  6 policemen and 3 SWAT members came in to eat while we were there-we figured that meant it was a good place to eat!
This place is classic, Italian, juicy good! Great taste, best value. Been going here since early 90's :)

This is my favorite Deli spot on Taylor Street and in the surrounding area. If I'm thinking a sandwich for lunch - I'm headed here hands down. They have a lot of home made options in their deli and their giardiniera is to die for. They have a frequent buyers card for sandwiches which rules if you pick your meals up a lot.  The staff is very friendly, I've never had any kind of issue or quarrel with that, which isn't quite the standard around the Little Italy areas or at least from my experience. I've even had a couple of the deli guys remember my order, which is awesome - can't beat that.  I always enjoy going in and peeping around at the new items they have or discovering something new I've never tried. They have a pretty unique grocery choice and a lot of hard to find items as well. I love it.  You should definitely pop in here for lunch on your next trip to Little Italy.

After reading the reviews, I decided to stop in and try a few sandwiches.  Dropped in early afternoon and was pleased to see a minimal line.  Ordered the Italian sub and the Italian beef, dipped, with hot giardiniera.  Within a few minutes, I was at the table with my sandwiches, deciding first on the Italian. It looked and smelled fantastic.  It had all of the elements in their proper proportion, but the meats didn't have any heat. It was a decent sandwich,  but not the combination of spicy flavors I expect from an Italian sub.  The ham wasn't cured like prosciutto, it was standard deli ham, which seemed to have a big impact on the finished product.   The Italian beef was juicy, but the texture was a little chewy.  Not in a bad way, just maybe a little sliced a little thicker.  Something didn't jive with this one either.  The flavors weren't blending together.  There was ample giardiniera, which did little for the overall taste of the sandwich (but it added a nice crunch).  The bread was chewier and seemed to absorb quite a bit of the juice - normally not a bad thing, but the flavor of the bread itself dominated all others.   Obviously, everyone has their favorite spot for Italian sandwiches and Conte Di Savoia has no shortage of loyal followers, so they must be doing something right.

Hands down one of the best Italian deli/markets I've ever been to. Get the turkey pastrami. The taste is remarkable. Got a few other items to take home which were also great. They have that refrigerator/ freezer area as well which is stocked well. Everything you would ever need for a great Italian meal. Love this place.

I love this place and after many more times of consuming their delicious sandwiches and encounters with their friendly staff I must say I'm a very happy customer. I always get the Italian sub with peppers and yummmmm! I'm not one to eat meatball sandwiches because I've tried many places and I've been disappointed but the meatball subs here are so delicious with great flavor that even though you may not like meatball subs theirs is the exception. The subs are great and their prices are too! If you're in the area and in the mood for a quick bite this is the place.
Delicious Italian subs. And gelato! I'll definitely be going back.

This place is just a few blocks from my house. I love the sandwiches and pre made food! Also a great place for your Italian meats and cheese! Try the lasagna it's amazing! Only reason I gave them a is one of the old men that works the counter can be mean.

Delicious!!!! We got the meatball sub and the Frank, and they were both phenomenal. Bonus-the guy making my sandwich had a braided rat tail which I think made it taste even bigger.  I did a little shopping in the market part and was very happy with the selection. I could do all my shopping here and never complain. A must if you're in Chicago.

Stopped in at Conte during Festa Italiana (Little Italy street festival) on a Sunday evening. Their booth outside was only selling meatball subs and I was really craving an Italian sub so I just walked into the store and ordered it from the counter. Great choice! There was no wait inside and I'm pretty sure the prices were cheaper in the store! They have a pretty extensive sandwich menu up on the wall and the prices are really cheap compared to many places in the city. They put a healthy amount of ham, pepperoni and salami on my sub and I added hot peppers for only 40 cents. Sandwich was great! Everyone working there was really nice and I got in and out in less than 5 minutes. I would love to come back to have another sandwich and check out the authentic Italian groceries stocking their shelves!

Tasty sandwiches with reasonable prices.  I've been going here for the past 2 decades from time to time as it was convenient when I used to work nearby.  Got a sandwich today and the quality is still just as good as before.

The sandwiches are always delicious, the bread is fresh, and the ingredients are of the highest quality. The price is right for the items, and you get your bang for your buck! I'm not a huge fan of sandwiches or subs, but I will always go to Conte for theirs, because they are the best! It's an Italian deli with groceries. Tons of Italian pastries, amazing pastas, and sandwiches await you here at Conte di Savoia.

They definitely do decent deli sandwiches here. Fast service, fresh ingredients, fair prices, and size-wise you get quite a bit for your buck. Overall it's a well oiled machine of an Italian deli.  If I had any criticism at all it'd be that the selection is a little plain. There's not much outside of the standard lettuce, onion, tomato, and mayo except for giardinera. Not necessarily a bad thing since all the stuff they do offer is awesome, but if you're looking for more of the works on your 8 inch sub you might be disappointed.  Other that sandwiches it's got all sorts of snacks, drinks, and other random stuff that you'd find at other delis like this. Overall a winner with friendly staff to boot!

I'm definitely going back, had a pretty good sandwich EXCEPT FOR THE BREAD. I don't know if I just had an over-baked piece for my sandwich but I know my Turano (which I was under the impression they used) bread and this was not it, didn't look like it, didn't taste like it. I'm from Berwyn home of Turano and well, sigh, this just was too dark and dry which is why I only gave 3 stars. The sandwich size and other flavors and textures were so good. Loved the convenience of on-line ordering and going straight to the register (yes, you still have to wait your turn behind all those waiting to pay) I had the Italian sub and added roasted red peppers and again - except for the bread it was so good! I guess I have to go back this week and see if I can change my rating! Really looking forward to trying a Panini as well.  There was seating inside and out, which on such a beautiful day I hated to bypass but I had to get back to work. Service was fast and friendly and there's a small park like area just feet away heading East where you can sit as well and enjoy your lunch.

Have been going to Conte Di Savoia for years. Madly in love their turkey submarine sandwiches(with olive oil!): the bun, turkey, lettuce, onions, & tomatoes are fresh; the provolone cheese is delicious. Conte Di Savoia's sandwiches are not skimpy with the turkey, lettuce, onions, & tomatoes in their sandwiches. Have purchased their frozen cheese tortellini & cheese ravioli which are scrumptious.

I've been here a few times, usually when I'm really hungry and don't want to wait too long to eat.  This place is a cute, little grocery store with authentic, home made, italian food and groceries.  They have a sandwich shop inside where you can sit down and eat.  There sandwiches are decent.  I had The Rosie the other day in a large size, ( I was really hungry) and half way through my sandwich I remember thinking, this sandwich is too salty.  I do wish they offered sides, like they have there ready-made pastas.
contes is the best sub place in chicago!!! enough said......

I love this deli! I've been going to this deli since the 90's when I was a student at UIC now that my daughter is attending UIC- we bought a house in the neighborhood and eat here 2-3 times a week. I had to bring lunch for 44 hungry and picky coworkers and decided to pick up 3 party sub trays. The place doesn't open until 9am but the owner who is wonderful was flexible and had my sandwiches ready by 7:40am even though we had a terrible snow storm that morning. The sandwiches were great - everybody loved them! I got a tray and a 1/2 of the Italian subs (my favorite), a tray of turkey, and a 1/2 tray of fresh mozzarella and sun-dried tomato. The mozzarella and sun-dried tomato was a huge hit everybody loved it, next time I'll get a full tray!  He also provided plenty of oil, mayo and mustard containers. If you need 1 sandwich or 75 sandwiches make sure you stop at Conte - you won't be disappointed!

Great groceries for your Italian meals!  Amazing in house made items as well, ravioli, pizza and pizza dough, gnocchi...all kinds of wonderful deli meats and cheeses.  Great subs also!! Do yourself a favor and get over there, please!
Get the Prosciutto sub, oil (I do mayo too but that's to your arteries' discretion...) lettuce, tomato, with sweet peppers. THE best cold sandwich in Chicago.

I love going to deli and sandwich shops, and this deli was no let down! My boyfriend and I ordered the turkey pastrami panini and a chicken panini, both with pepper-jack cheese and mayo. Everything tasted as fresh as it gets, and it they were both absolutely delicious. The guys making the sandwiches here were friendly, as well. The store offers a nice selection of wines, imported goods, a small selection of groceries and Italian foods. The prices here are amazing for a downtown location with food this good. If I ever have the opportunity to visit this area again, this will be one of my first stops.

One thing I love about my job is it takes me all over the city and I get the opportunity to shop-dine all over. I love the Tri-Taylor area, and can spend some serious money real easy here. Cute little local shops and eateries. Conte being one of them. This place is second to my all time favorite for sandwiches, I won't name the other in fairness to this review, the other I rate really high so saying this is second is a lot. In addition to sandwiches there is stuff to take home, you want a tray of meatballs, or a selection of homemade pastas and sauces, go for it. They have homemade lasagna sheets if you want to do something non-traditional, how about pumpkin or some other squash instead of cheese and meat, or spinach and mushroom stuff anything you want between those sheets, easy. The other fun option is ready made pizza crusts, thin crust to bring home and add your own toppings. Tonight we'll do basil and mushroom! Then there is salami, so so good, and cheeses, pair that with some wine from their not huge but well balanced wine selection. They also carry a few varieties of coffee in bean or ground form. Speaking of coffee, their lattes beat the pants off the Starbucks a couple of doors down, and they cost less. That is of course if you can keep yourself from spending the savings on the cookies displayed right there. It's amazing that such a little place can deliver so much happiness.
Great fresh sandwiches.  Fast, easy, and everyone is very nice.  Love their turkey sub.
Delicious sandwiches and great prices! Maybe it's the Turano bread, but their sandwiches remind me a lot of the sandwiches from Manginos before they sadly closed a few years ago.

I've been a customer for 7 years.  Hands down, the best Italian deli in Chicago.  I make sure to eat my Sunday lunch there at least 3 times a month.  A fully packed sandwich on fresh bread and an espresso at Conte Di Savoia are the best way to start off your Sunday afternoon.      All of the homemade food is amazing - fresh or frozen. The olive bar with homemade salads will never let you down.  They always have a phenomenal selection of homemade pastas in the freezer: several types ravioli, several types of gnocchi, cavatelli, etc...  The homemade sauces are also outstanding.  Finally, their fresh sausage is the best in town, both hot and mild. The prices are unbeatable, the service is excellent, and all of the employees are friendly.  It's a must visit.

Yum! Since leaving the East Coast a few years ago I hadn't had an Italian sandwich (they don't have them in Portland). We stopped by for a late lunch and shared the jumbo Italian.  It was great! Bought a nostalgic tear to my eye....

This place is an old school Italian Deli. Subs made to eat. Also the selection of Olives are outstanding. The Italian sub was perfect. The made how I wanted it. I will be stoping here again. There is a place to sit down but you can carry out just as easily!

The staff is amazing here.  We requested for 25 sandwiches for one of our events this month and Conte Di Savoia was willing to lend us a hand.   Actually, we miscalculated how much food we needed and requested 15 more sandwiches the day before the event and had noted that we would pay for the additional 15.  Conte Di Savoia was very very bountiful in donating all 40 sandwiches to our agency free of charge. We had an assortment of Vegetarian & Italian Sandwiches.  Both are delicious, can't go wrong with either one. Thank You Thank You Thank You!     - The Chicago Lighthouse

Local place for all your Italian grocery needs.  First off the Italian sub felt a little overrated, I've had better.  Though the meats were top notch, dressing was a little light but the bread was too much.  Some will say it's authentic but I've had better at another Italian deli we frequent.  Excellent meats and cheeses for cutting.  Cutter knew his meat when steering us towards the saltier prosciutto.  Lots of sauces (had Tuscany Brandy sauce I was looking for), noodles (all sizes, types and brands) and other delicacies.  Haven't tried their homemade frozen ravioli yet.  They have wine as well but didn't check it out.  Breads were minimal, again I've seen better selection elsewhere (I went at 1pm so in all fairness maybe selection was affected though I think not).  Cookies were disappointing more like a cake dough rather than a cookie. Ambience was like something from a NY storefront deli without the attitude.  Will definitely keep it in mind when we want authentic Italian grocery items.
Good salads and cookies

I'm conflicted about giving Conte di Savoia five stars. On the one hand, they put mustard on my sandwich (I dislike mustard with a passion). On the other hand, I didn't notice the mustard until I was 3/4 of the way done and feel it only enhanced my sandwich. Given my mustard identity crisis, I feel my only recourse is to go back and try another sandwich. Staff is super friendly. They share my joy of deli meats.

Hard to find at first, but it took me right back to Rome. It is a small grocery and deli cafe, with pellegrino sodas and fresh baguettes. Their cannolis are awesome, and prosciutto is perfect (a little salty like it should be).  Next time I really want to try their mozzarella and maybe pick up some italian grocery items. Make a stop here, you will love it.
The Italian with the fresh moz is where it's at! This is a wonderful find for Italian groceries / meats/ cheeses .  The homemade Italian cookies were fresh and yummy! Go...

First time ordered an Italian.  Fresh made, good bread and I love the spicy notes from the sopressata.  Grabbed some frozen ravioli as well.  Looked like a nice selection of wines.  Cozy front seating area with grocery/deli in back.

This was a cute little place. Reminds me of the Chicago version of our Cicero favorite, Freddy's. It's like an old school Italian deli, with a section of tables so you can order at the counter and then eat in. I don't remember what I ordered -it was some kind of Italian sub sandwich -but it was really good. Nice crowd, good ambiance. It's really exciting to find some new places and get out of the Cicero rut!

Simply put... their sub sandwiches set the standard for excellence and freshness of ingredients.  Lots of Italian groceries, neatly shelved, make up the rest of the store.  There are tables looking out to the Taylor Street scene and, in summer, a small outdoor café.

The best Italian Delicate downtown Chicago. Most of the products are imported from Italy and all of them are very good quality. The people who work there are very experienced and it is owed by an Italian family with a very good understanding of Italian food. Subs, hot panini, salads, coffee are ready in 2 minutes. People usually go for lunch just because you can also seat there and eat(You don't have to worry about tip)

We used to live right around the corner from here and having moved to Bucktown, we miss it dearly. I stopped in today for some smoked mozzarella, premade pesto, proscuitto and risotto rice. The guys at the deli were friendly as always and the prices are incredible! I got .25 lbs of cheese and meat, 8 oz. of pesto, and the rice for $16!!  It might not have the bells, whistles, or star power but this family owned Italian deli beats Eataly in value and service any day of the week!

This place has delicious sandwiches, salads, and hard to find pastas and authentic Italian sauces to go. They also have really good Italian cookies that are highly addictive. The service has always been really friendly and helpful.

Great Italian bread on the deli sandwiches! I had my own sandwich of Turkey and Salami with Provolone and a splash of Oil & Vinegar. The meats and cheeses are all the best so the sandwich comes down to the bread. The crispy crust and chewy bread dazzle the taste buds and everything comes together on the palate for a perfectly harmonious delight. Great sandwich!!

This was my first visit. It was good overall. You order at the counter, just like you do for deli. Pick up a number, wait a little, go pay and enjoy. It is super casual since it's more of a bottega. There are traditional items and Italian brands on the shelves. Next time I'll I'll go for a stroll to see what's really available. It looks promising though. Panino mozzarella e sun dried tomatoes was good.  Coffee was good, but I got the lungo. Paid 8.88 for both, I think it should have been less to make it great, 6.50 or 7max.

Italian subs are a perfect lunch with my italian boyfriend, and I'm really glad this is where we ended up.  After five years of being spoiled by sandwiches in New Jersey, I often find Chicago delis lacking.  But not at Conte.  The bread, the meat, the everything was just perfect.  Followed by a trip to Ferrara for cannoli, it was a perfect Thursday afternoon on the edges of Little Italy.

This place is incredible. I walked in one day while strolling around Little Italy, not long after I moved to Chicago, and it was an excellent decision. I'm almost full Italian, and their prosciutto panini is as good as it gets.  For like, $7, you get a HUGE sandwich made with Turano bread (awesome), lightly brushed with oil, toasted to perfection... add some paper-thin slices of salty prosciutto, fresh mozzarella cheese and some shredded lettuce to crisp it up, and you've got yourself one heck of a lunch. Great deals - make sure to enjoy the sandwich with a bottle of Orangina -- you'll get the full "Italian" experience.  The atmosphere is pretty much what you'd expect for an authentic deli/grocery store. There are a few crowded aisles crammed with imported Italian goodies like wine, pasta, sauces, even the pickled eggplant strips that my Italian mother loves so much. There's a deli counter where you can order sandwiches, meats and some salads, and there are some refrigerators and freezers with fresh pasta and other dishes. There's a small room, kind of in the back, with drinks and cheeses.  Another great deal - I got a huge bag of fresh basil for $1.25 and another bag of polenta (perfect for the bottom of pizza!) for $1.50. They're by the register. One last note - I don't live anywhere close to Conte di Savoia. I have to take two trains to get here, and it is completely, one hundred percent worth it.
Ordered some subs.  Italian and a meatball.  They were pretty good, but nothing special.

Went here today with some co-workers and really enjoyed it.  My turkey sandwich was really good, you could tell that they used quality lunch meat and the bread was made that day, it tasted very fresh.  I cant wait to go back and try some of their other sammys.
Great neighborhood Italian deli.  Get the Italian.  Perfect.
Amazing Italian subs, and lots more. I'm hooked.

It's the real deal. Great grocery selection (bought some ricotta gnocchi in the fridge section that was unreal) and fantastic, cheap deli sandwiches. Everything tastes just right, all high quality, low price italian sandwiches, textbook.
You can walk past and mistake this joint for a small grocery store, and it kind of is. The lunch here is quick and awesome; the best Italian submarine sandwiches.

Best Italian sub I've ever had. Lived in the neighborhood for 5 years and ate there at least once a week. I've lived in other parts of the city for the last 4 years, and I still drive there maybe once a month for it. I've tried other places, but they've got nothing on Conte. Unwavering quality for 9 years now! Go there NOW! And get the large Italian!

Absolutely love this place. I agree with everyone who says it's a hidden gem. I live close by, and I frequent it once a week. It's more of a neighborhood market, with fresh meats, cheeses and pastas. They also have anything Italian you could want, like frozen/dried pastas, oils, sauces, bread, fresh basil, etc. It's all reasonably priced as well. My favorite part of the store definitely has to be the fresh cheeses. I can get a half pound block of fresh creamy feta (way better than the crumbled chain store version) for $3.  They also make sandwiches fresh to order! I've had the mozzarella/veggie one and the grilled eggplant, and both were fantastic. The sandwiches are also reasonably priced, and you can order whatever size you want. The staff is also great, and are extremely friendly.
Love their Caprese sandwich. Nice place to go to lunch if in the area. Prices are reasonable and the service is great. Also a good place to buy fresh Mozzarella cheese, Salami or other deli items.

Great, fresh deli sandwiches. I've gone a few times for lunch and have tried a couple different sandwiches and have not been disappointed.  You receive a high quality at a very reasonable price. i would recomment it to anyone in the area to check it out. The staff was also very friendly and helpful.

Being Italian, I'm very particular with Italian things. I got the vegetable (eggplant and artichoke) panini and it was GREAT! My boyfriend got the meatball, said it was one of the best meatballs he's ever had, and another friend got the Italian sub, also excellent! I purchased some fresh mozzarella (amazing, still warm), fresh ricotta (equally amazing) and some seafood salad (alright). They carry San Pelligrino Chinotto, which was also such a plus!! Great food and great staff!

Had always passed by this place and was so glad I stopped in. They have a little deli and grocery store so you can get a sandwich and choose from a large selection of sides (both from the deli and stuff in the grocery store) and tons of beverages. The sandwiches are made fresh and they have some pretty good ingredients there. The best part is that the sandwiches are very reasonably priced making them a great deal and a good incentive to keep coming back. Would definitely recommend to a friend and will definitely return in the future.
It's been awhile since I have gone to this restaurant, we had a Groupon and the sandwich we got was very tasty!  I'm actually surprised I haven't gone back! The food and the service was really great!

This place is great, have been shopping here for years.  It reminds me of the Italian stores my mom used to take us shopping when we were kids.  I love the atmosphere...neighborhood residents hanging out in front or in the store having coffee and talking.  It has all of the Italian delicacies you can't find in a regular grocery store.  I generally come in here for standard Italian provisions - freshly grated Parm, Ricotta (please don't tell me you buy that stuff they claim is Ricotta at a regular grocery store - you will thank me if you start buying it here!),Italian cookies.  Have also had a few subs and they are tasty.  I recently tried the new meatball sub they added to their sandwich menu, might be the best meatball sub in the city.  Simple and to the point - terrific and moist meatballs, rich sauce, D'amato bread and a sprinkydink of Parm.  Love it!

Walking distance from work - CHECK Great selection of lunch items like sandwiches, soups, pastas- CHECK Affordable - CHECK Can pick up delicious authentic Italian meats, cheeses, olives, etc to take home for dinner at the same time - WE HAVE A WINNER!!! BONUS: Homemade Fresh Mozzarella is D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S! ...'nuff said.

$4.97 for an Italian sub, bag of chips, and can of pop... thank you Conte Di Savoia from the bottom of my poor grad student heart!!   I've been wanting to try this deli for a long time because of the great reviews it has and the fact that I live about a 5 minute walk away.  It's great to see a truly Italian establishment still in Little Italy, so I was more than happy  to support them!  The sandwich was great, full of Italian meats, tomato, lettuce, and oil.  I only ate half of my sandwich, so I'm happy I got two meals out of my $5!  Will definitely be back the next time I have a sandwich craving.

Can I give 10 stars? I used to live across the street and the only thing I miss about the neighborhood is Conte Di Savoia.  The sandwiches are my favorite in the city and the owner is always pleasant.  Chicago based family business with high quality offerings.  I love this place so much I almost moved back just to be close to it. You won't go to any other deli/sandwich shop once you visit Conte!  There is also a smaller location open weekdays on the 2200 block of Taylor.
This is legit Italian deli.  I buy Italian sausages, pasta and sauce.

Came here twice yesterday and really enjoyed myself. First I came here for a triple espresso and homemade canoli, which were amazing. Grabbed a Sun-Times and relaxed. After walking across the street to the Italian Sports Museum, I came back here and had the Italian Sando. It was excellent and recommend subbing out the ham for the sopresata and going with the vinegar and oil dressing on top. Its a home run. If I lived in Chicago I would buy plenty of stuff here.
Fresh, authentic Italian subs. Good Prices too. This stuff blows Potbellys/Jimmy Johns/etc out of the water.

So Sad I don't live by it anymore.  I now work downtown, and will occasionally make the 30 min walk over. Everything is good, but I'd recommend adding fresh mozz and roasted red pepper to your sub. Would give 6 stars if I could.

I've lived across from this store/restaurant/deli for about 3 years now and my love for it has only become greater with time.  First of all, the prices are great. You can get a delicious Italian sandwich, chips, and a drink for less than 5 dollars(prosciutto sandwich is good too but a little more expensive). If you're not in the mood for a sandwich, get the house salad which is really big and costs only a little over $5. During the summer, I tend to go to Conte a lot. I just get my sandwich and sit and eat while watching the food channel that's always on. By the way, I highly recommend watching it while eating -- interactively watching someone get really excited about his/her food makes me have a considerably more enjoyable experience while eating my own food... Alright second of all, this little place has almost everything that you need to survive. Besides sandwiches/salads, it has frozen pasta, homemade cheese and meats, condiments, really yum cookies, beer, an assortment of wine, irresistible chocolates, coffee and more.  Third of all, this place is really cozy - not only because of its size but also because of the friendly people who you always see working there.  I love to go here before or after a workout for those sandwiches!
It's a deli. Not somewhere you would take a friend really to go out to eat.  Delicious though.  The house salad is so good (artichoke, pickled eggplant, salami, and cheese). YUM!

It's not easy to find a good, old-school sandwich in the city. My partner decided to take me here as we were running around town. And when you walk in, you can't tell they serve food but you can tell they serve it. It's more market than deli, but I was not daunted. All the way to the back, I ordered my capicolla sandwich with all the trimmings and a small salad. We went to the small sitting area toward the front, sunk our teeth in, and was in sandwichland in no time. The sandwich itself was very tasty and well proportioned. I didn't feel hungry after I left. Parking's a nightmare on Taylor. We found secret-squirrel parking one block south. You can cut through the empty lot directly across the street.

This is a little market/deli in Little Italy.  I tried a pastrami panini a couple of days ago for lunch.  For 6.25, it was a good panini sandwich with good portion.  However the meat portion was smaller than I expected, and I wasn't that impressed by the flavor, either. The service was great, by the way.
great service, good daily deals, fresh food and a cool grocery (for those that cook)

The minute you walk into this little market, that's in the heart of Little Italy in Chicago, your eyes will light up like mine did when you see all of the peppers, pestos, sausages, salami's, cheeses, homemade pasta, and umpteen different sub sandwiches you can choose from. Love it's simple, no-frills, and quick service here.  They carry some fresh bread from D'Amato's Bakery here as well which is tasty. I tried the tomato bread that was mmmm... delish.  You can eat your subs in the smallish eating area or take it to go. Metered parking or several bus stops nearby.  Definitely try Conte Di Savoia's if you LUV italian eats like me!
Fresh delish italian deli! Go here for a cheap quick lunch!

One of my favorite places by UIC. The eggplant sandwich is amazing, especially with fresh mozzarella. The eggplant is pickled, and it just has the most fantastic flavor which soaks into the bread. It's basically a little euro specialty store and deli where they will make sandwiches and salads. They also deliver! Polite service, and a great place to stop by for a fresh bite.

Please note: before coming here, check Groupon Now! They often have $5 coupon for $10 sandwiches which make the food become super cheap and much tastier :D I love the beef sandwich the most but other are delicious as well. A little (hopefully not hidden) gem in the neighborhood.

Review of the sandwiches only. Solid. Maybe too solid, though I don't know what I really mean by that. I got the italian sandwich and it make me a happy camper. I think I would come here a lot more often if I were in the area.  The prices are pretty standard sandwich prices. I would probably come here instead of the nearby potbelly or subways. It has a very neighborhood feel. When I went I saw mostly white people, whom I imagined to be all Italian because now I can say this place is authentic.
Great place, really good prices, and a nice staff.  I frequent them, sometimes with Groupon Nows and sometimes without (their lunch special is the best in the neighborhood).

Update: Tried the roast beef recently, it rocked my socks off. Ordinarily I detest roast beef sandwiches, but this is succulent - prepared with thinly sliced real roast beef cooked to a medium-medium rare. I didn't think it got better than this place's ham and capicola - leave it to Conte to top itself!

I sought out Conte di savoia as I was planning our holiday party. We ordered two catered items of Meatballs and sausage and peppers. OMG the food was absolutely amazing and the service I received was bar none, the best! I would highly recommend them and I would definitely use them again!

I used to live literally a two minute walk from this place...  and I can't tell you how much I miss it.  Now every time my husband and I drive from Chicago to Columbus we ALWAYS stop here and get sandwiches for the trip home.  (On the way in from Columbus we always stop for Italian Beef.  :-))  We also pick up BAGS AND BAGS of frozen pasta to take home as well.  You guys who live around here don't know how good you've got it!!!  (OK, I consider everyone who lives in Chicago lucky, but that's a whole 'nother story.)

amazing sandwiches. we have tried multiple sandwiches - roast beef, italian, veggie - all are fantastic. their potato salads and salads are great too. service is quick, prices are low, and people are friendly. great place to pick up a delicious sandwich
Totally fantastic.  Great deli - open on Sundays!  Something about that giardinara is to die for.  Best bread in Little Italy

We came for a quick lunch on a week day. The deli was a well stocked delight with authentic imports from Italy. I loved the selections avaible and was impressed with their frozen pasta selection. The review is based on the sandwiches. we ordered proscuitto sandwich - ok, slightly salty italian sandwich - ok, need more seasoning i thought this is a great deal for sandwiches in the university village area. I thought the ingredients inside are good, but the bread is chewy. It would be better if toasted or grilled.
Great sandwiches (prosciutto provolone is awesome).  Lots of other italian groceries

Sometimes the glitz and glamour of a toasted sub is overkill. Sometimes all you crave is for someone to slap some meat and toppings between two bread walls, wrap it up in paper and hand it to you over a deli. Sometimes that simple preparation is all you need.  When all you crave is that simple sub, come here. They are a small Italian grocery store deli, with fresh meats and fresh bread. Their subs are quite affordable and the veggies on the sub are always fresh.  They have a giardiniera that boasts large chunks of veggies that aren't too diced up.  My only gripe about these subs is that I wish the Italian sub had a cured ham or a saltier ham to help add some pop to the "Italian" in the Italian sub..  They have an amazing selection of olives and cheeses and other fine Italian imported products. They have Gelato for $1. They also have a sister location further west on Taylor close to Western.

i LOVE this place! I am addicted to italian deli meats and I come here to get my beloved prociutto provolone pretty often. SO yummy! Unlike many other places, they keep their prices reasonable and don't charge $10+ for a sandwich just cause it has some meat and cheese on it. They don't skimp and it feels warm and inviting in here. It seems like your typical nostalgic neighborhood deli/grocery store. I shall be in soon for another sandwich! :)

ok Thanks but no thanks to Groupon.  I purchased those Groupon Certificates that are only for food items that are prepared there .. Thats fine.. but my Panini and chips were a bit typical and they taste just ok.. The store portion is Great when needing some Italian goods but the only staff happy to see us was the cashier.. .. not sure IF I would return .

A lunch break favorite, this local deli is holding strong against the neighboring Subway, Potbelly, and Jimmy Johns. The friendly mom and pop atmosphere is unbeatable. It's also perfect for those obscure European items that you just can't seem to find at the grocery store.

I work nearby, and we often pick up sandwiches for lunch.   I had never tried an Italian sub before coming here.  Now, I'm HOOKED.  I can very rarely order anything else. I will say that the other sandwiches I've tried are very tasty as well.  The ingredients are fresh and the bread just perfect.  The prices are very reasonable too. This place is so cute and everyone so friendly.  Love the cute neighborhood feel.

I shop here when I need lasagna provisions.  I can get all three cheese, scarmoza, Parmesan and ricotta.  This is the only place where I find the scarmoza I prefer.  The choices for ricotta and Parmesan are exceptional and plenty.  They have the noodles, herbs and sauces I need, also . The bread choices are also very good. They are plenty and fresh baked, from a local bakery. I can also get a very decent bottle of red wine, at various prices to go along with the meal. If I don't feel up to the job I can pick up some scrumptious pasta.  Vegetable, cheese or meat stuffed ravioli, plain noodles or colored.  I don't know if I should share this information but they have squid pasta.  It is the black pasta in the dry pasta section.

best italian sandwich in a city full of good italian sandwiches.  I have had them all, and this is my preference.  great grocery as well.  even though i usually go there for sandwiches, i almost always walk out of there with a bunch of other items...olive oil, giardiniera, truffle oil, prociutto, etc.  and its all high quality.

These are decent sandwiches.  I ordered an Italian and a salami.  They were both pretty good.  This is the only place I've had an Italian sub that compares to Alpine in Elmwood Park (see earlier review).  Its nearly there, but just not quite the same.  A great alternative and much more local.  I'll definately go back and try a few other things, as well as do a bit of shopping for authentic Italian products.  A giant jar of pesto has my name all over it.  yum.

This is a great place! There is so much cool food. You can eat there or take some groceries home and make a fantastic meal! Everything is so delicious. The service is great too, good neighborhood friendly people.

Hands down my favorite sub-stop, deli, italian grocery, and cafe in one. Conti is a staple in Little Italy. Best lunch deal on taylor with a small italian sub, chips, and soda for $4.98 after tax. Check out the unique selection of sausages, salamis, and imported cheeses as well as the homemade pastas, sauces, or whole lasagnas in the freezer. Just heat it up and serve with some of the fresh italian sausage under the glass counter and a loaf of delicious victor damato bread. They also cater and do take out. The fresh espresso is far superior and much cheaper than neighboring starbucks as well.

Well, I'm in love. Not only is their grocery section adorable and full of fun imported Italian items, but their sandwiches are amaaaazing. Everything is fresh and they're pretty huge! I don't know why anyone would go to Potbelly, Subway or Jimmy Johns (all nearby) after trying Conte's subs.

I've had Conte bookmarked for a few months after seeing it hyped up on Yelp, as were Bari and Graziano.  Graziano was the reigning king of the Italian sub in my mind before I ever stepped foot into Conte.  I had killer subs from Graziano twice before being not as enthralled with the third sub I got there recently.  Something just wasn't right with that last sub.  It was likely just a one off misstep.  Still, I felt as a result that I would give Conte a try.  It also helped that Conte is open on Sundays.  None of the other Italian sub joints in the area are.  So off to Taylor Street I went. Conte is similar to Bari, as it's an Italian grocery.  I took a look at some of the pasta sauces and found them to be around in line with the local big grocers.  They also have all the other ingredients for your Italian cooking needs.  I could see coming to Conte to shop for such ingredients if you're cooking from scratch or in the area and just need a few things.  I don't think I'd go out of my way for these items myself, but I'm not Mother at home whipping up some old world Italian.   So I simply ordered my Italian subs and called it a day.  One ham.  One turkey.  One for now, and one for later.  Great Sunday grub.  The bread they use at Conte is the shorter, wider type Italian bread rather than the long and skinny used at Graziano.  Overall, I loved both subs and would say it's a real horse race between Conte and Graziano.  Conte might even be a smidge better than Graziano, depending on the day.  Two large, delicious subs for ten bucks and change?  I'll be back. As I left Conte, I said hi to Mother presiding over all at the table in the window.  I imagine she had some wonderful old world Italian sauce simmering on the stove top right around the corner for later that evening.  I didn't get an invite, but she smiled and said hello right back.  I like old ladies.   Five stars.

This was my favorite grocery/deli place when I lived in Little Italy. I loved the smell of fresh bread on Thursdays. This little store reminds me of Paris (because it's the only place in Europe that I've been, not because it's Parisian-like). I love the rows and rows of canned and packaged goods from Italy. I would always get my pastas here, as well as cured meat, olives, tomato sauces, fruit jams, etc.  I miss having a place like this to walk to now that I don't live in the neighborhood. It was always my favorite stop whenever I decided to take a walk down Taylor Street.

They have a deli there where they make subs and the Italian sub with oil, vinegar and peppers is unblvbl.  Before leaving, stop by the freezer section and get some filled pasta and sauce to take home and make whenever.  I love this place for so many reasons, not the least of which is  I can make an awesome Italian dinner for guests in about 10 minutes and they'll continue to think I can actually cook.
Conte Di Savoia offers very ordinary Italian sandwiches.  This place does not live up to the hype.

Conte is awesome.  Definitely a must-try in Chicago.  I used to live in the neighborhood and I would probably hit this place up once a week.  As other reviewers are noting Conte is really 1- a sandwich shop and 2- an italian grocer. 1 - the subs are awesome.  The Italian is great - very fresh meats - very tasty.  I am a big fan of the mozzarella sandwich - fresh/thick mozzarella, roasted red peppers, basil.  So so good!  You can eat inside at one of the little tables or take it to go to eat in the nearby park. 2 - awesome selection of groceries.  You can buy their fresh meat/cheeses which are sometimes much cheaper than heading to Jewel.  They also have fresh bread, frozen pastas and pizzas, a selection of wine, dried pastas, seasoning.  If you need to pick up food for an appetizer, bring something home from the city for your parents, then this is the place to pick them out.  Always something unique, interesting and tasty! Wish I still lived close by!
My vote for best italian sub in Chicago.

This place is really a two-in-one restaurant and specialty food shop.  Based on the restaurant alone, I'd give it a 3.  The sandwiches are pretty good - I've had the Italian, the Tuna Salad, and the Turkey Pastrami.  The Turkey Pastrami is may favorite.  And believe it or not, I kind of like the regular wheat bread over their Italian roll.  But that's personal preference.  Make sure you get extra hot peppers - they're pretty good and have good heat.  The service is only medium friendly, especially since I'm there every Thursday at an off-meal time, so you'd think maybe they'd chat it up while I'm waiting or something, but oh well. Now, what makes it a 4, is the grocery section.  Sooooo awesome!  I could walk through there for hours.  If there's any Italian product you've ever looked for, try here!  And their selection of both fresh/frozen and dried pasta is amazing.  The pesto stuffed gnocchi was seriously delicious.  And they have a great selection of great fresh breads that are available too.

I'm so glad that I finally found my place for pasta supplies! Their ravioli is simply incredible. Pro-grade. You don't even need sauce to enjoy a variety of ravioli - mushroom, pesto, chicken, etc. The ravioli sheets are well made. They don't break easily. Besides, you can find a whole product line of pasta varieties, from angel hair to lasagna, as well as sauces and cookies at this place. Sandwich is worth trying, too. Not top-notch but at least decent, comparable to Potbelly's. Price tags don't look super friendly, but still, this place doesn't rip you off. Try their ravioli and you won't regret it!

Finally got the chance to duck in here.  Interesting selection of domestic and imported Italian goods.  Fine looking deli counter, fresh and dried handmade pastas, limonatas and 'illy' espresso. This first visit I took home some of their homemade frozen stuffed pastas (asparagus ravioli and meat tortellacci) along with a pint of their vodka sauce.

Pretty good.  Only visited once and had a sandwich.  I love deli sandwiches better than any chain sandwich shop.  The reason I give it a 4 is because I have had better deli food.  Love the imported stuff you can't find anywhere else.
Fresh grinder, coke, chips $6?  You really can't go wrong.  Plus, I've heard the octopus salad is the bomb!

Great little Italian place. Not just a sub shop (though a good one), but also a grocery store. With wine, cheese, frozen pesto, tasty imported jams and jellies... This is the place that introduced me to the joys of bitter orange marmalade, which I bake into things to much rejoicing. Stop in for a sandwich, and explore some new possibilities for your own kitchen.  Oh--and they carry muscat! Gotta love the dessert wines. Can you tell I have a sweet tooth? (I don't know how they'd deal with you drinking on the premises--I think the alcohol is sold as a grocery item. Not a place I'd go to drink anyway.)

BEST PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH IN THE CITY by far. Just enough meat and this is the spot that knows what its doing. I don't really care for the "other" spot on the "other" side of Taylor and Damen. Due to the owner being very condescending with his customers just with his looks and how he looks at certain individuals. But this location just erases all that way. Come by and have a taste and see for yourself.

I go here maybe 2x a week so that says a lot about the place.  As a vegetarian, I find it pretty hard to get good sandwiches here in Chicago, seeing as everything has meat on it or is stuffed with meat or is soacked in meat.  But thankfully Conte's has a great cheese sub (amazing deli slices) along with probably the best fresh mozzerella sandwich ive ever had.  And to boot, everything is reasonably priced with plenty of selections.

Phenomenal!!!  No other way to describe it!  Wonderful fresh made subs, great antipasto and a wide variety of delectable European groceries available under one roof.  I wish I lived closer so I could take more advantage of all it has to offer.   Great place to grab lunch and watch the people walk by.

It's too bad not every neighborhood has a specialty grocery store like this, with the convenient, tasty and very reasonably-priced lunch items, frozen hand-made Italian pasta, and the extraordinary choices of other specialty foods. A nice grounded little gathering spot for the Little Italy community. And there's always a fat Chicago cop or two around to serve and protect. And to lend credibility to the good food reputation of the place. I met a friend for lunch whilst in the medical district just west of Conti. We both took advantage of the lunch special of a small Italian sub, chips and a drink. $4.50. Can't beat that. Almost half the cost of the Potbelly equivalent. The sub was nicely packed with several deli meats and cheese. They also have great salads, and things like eggplant subs which you wouldn't find at a standard sub shop.  I always find something else to take home here. Fresh basil plants, a jar of big fat capers, some EVOO in a special containers or some rare balsamic vinegar for gifting. And cheese!!!  I love the old word intimate, New York (or Hoboken) vibe of this place. Very unpretentious and always a great spot for lunch on Taylor Street.

I'll admit. I know everything about this kind of place.  I used to work in an Alimientari JUST like this one in Kansas City.  Frankly, Conte Di Savoia brings me back home to that place, because it is so similar.  The choices of products are spot on, prices are a little high because of the EURO and not overpricing.  Sandwiches are good, consistent, and the gang behind the counter always ask ya "how you are doin' hun" or something like that... just like it should be. It has been there for many many years and I hope it does not change.  It is a little piece of home here in Chi-town

Great deli. Wish the help smiled once in awhile. Employees look and act like they are in absolute misery. Will not go back in this place again,  unless I feel like ruining my day with negativity. Go to Fontano's, at least they offer service with a smile. I think Conte Di Savoia translates to "Nasty people work here!"

Hello, FOOD SNOB back again. After my Pannini at the west location, I stopped here to pick up some ingredients for my Goat Cheese Pizza this weekend.   This place has it all.  Just like a Blast from the Past.   Italian Food imports,  wines, sandwiches like their famous Italian Sub. And great Espresso. Cafe etc. Why can't there be more places like this, not of just italian origin but all other nationalities too.   What is with all these franchises out there today.
Good place to run in and grab food.  Their homemade frozen pastas are delicious. The staff is unfriendly but if you're in and out it's worth going.

Excellent deli sub with a matching excellent price. The Italian with hot peppers is dynamite. I sometimes pick up other snacks here and overall have not been disappointed. They have a thoughtful selection of cheese, salami, ravioli and deli salads. The wine selection though is pretty shoddy, hence the -1 star, and I've been in there on warmer days and the wines at higher temperatures tend to suffer.
Best Italian subs in the city! The meats, cheeses, and breads are so fresh! And the price can't be beat. They take credit card which is huge for a small mom-and-pop Italian deli.

Excellent spot for cold cut sandwiches...the italian sub is my fav..very affordable lunch spot...its more like a deli but the service is good and the french bread is great..they also have a lot of fresh cheeses and meats...also many italian goods...sauces, pastas etc...

Now in my final year at UIC I have finally walked into Conte Di Savoia and enjoyed the laid back Italian grocery atmosphere. There cheese and meat selection is pretty robust for such a small grocery and even though I wasn't able to eat meat on the Friday I went there their pasta salads made my stomach smile. Their sandwich menu guarantees me to come back.

Conti has been my go-to midday sub place for quite some time now. They tend to be slightly unfriendly, but in a 'you're part of our family so we're not gonna act fake' kind of way. Their subs are delish; the Italian sub is really the only thing you should be ordering. Their meats and cheeses are good too.  The gorceries are great for the 'i'm back at grandma's house' feeling, but you gotta watch the expiration dates on some things ...

My favorite lunch in Chicago might be Conte's mozzarella and sun dried tomato sub with hot peppers (hold the oil) and a bottle of Berghoff root beer.  In addition to excellent sandwiches, they have great Italian cheeses (homemade mozzarella and fresh ricotta are my favorties) and an excellent frozen food selection (the gnocchi and ravioli are exceptional).  I like the prices, the staff, the parking in back and the location.  Highly recommended.

You need to ask yourself, how hungry am I?  After you leave this place you will have a smile from ear to ear.  Great place to have an authentic Italian sub.  Your deli meat will be sliced when you order your sandwich, every time!  They are so consistent with this step, it's awesome!  You will need have pre sliced deli meat at this joint.  I normally get the Italian and my wife gets the chicken breast and we have never been disappointed, ever! I recommend this place for a true down home feel.  There's tons of prepared foods that you can throw in the oven and have for dinner.  It's like stepping  into a small italian store, you'll find everything you need to make your own culinary masterpiece. It's Molto Buono!!  BTW, awesome Italian sweets and espresso!

I love this place.  A great Italian deli with amazing sandwiches and a lot of hard to find grocery items.  I love their Italian sub and their turkey sub.  Very basic - bread, oil, lettuce, tomato, meat - but its the quality of the ingredients that puts it over the top.  Why anyone would go to the potbelly's across the street is a mystery to me. And the grocery store is great too.  Great cheap Italian sausage and fresh pasta, wine, Italian cookies, etc.   And on top of it all, the Italian husband and wife owners work behind the counter and give great service.

We like to hit up this little Italian import grocery for a few reasons.  Fresh ricotta cheese and Italian sausage for our holiday lasagna fests, or some of their delightful ravioli (I believe they make it and freeze it themselves) - they have all kinds of fillings, different cheeses, squash, meats.  Wine selection is not astounding, and is pricey.  I suppose if you're fond of the various Italian cookies - the ones with the kind of waffle-textured wafers and chocolate filling.  They've got other Italian staples - olive oil in jugs, orangina and limonata, etc. I see a lot of the local elders hanging out here with a sandwich and a cappuccino.  I have yet to try out the deli sandwiches and cappuccinos.  But, as an Italian grocery with delightful fresh meats and cheeses, and decent breads.
This place has GREAT Italian-style subs, Light years better than the anon gadfly's chain. And the Italian grocery/deli has a great selection of pastas, sauces, candies, cookies, etc.

Pleasant atmosphere in a cozy store-deli. The Italian sub was nothing special, however. Fine as far as it goes, and I suppose it's nice if you live in the neighborhood, as some of the patrons obviously do. But it's nowhere close to the subs at Bari on Grand. That's the Italian sub benchmark.

as good as it gets when it comes to fresh sub sandwiches.  Have been eating here for years and it never gets old.  If you start to tire of your fav classic, just switch it up turkey/roast beef  , prosciutto/ fresh mozzarella - any mix works.

Pasta, pasta sauces (including made-on-premises frozen ones), products from Italy, bulk spices, deli meats, cheeses, bread, food, candy, cookies, coffee, espresso===sandwiches made to order In summer--basil plants, rosemary plants Street parking on Taylor, or a few free spaces in the rear of the store off the alley. I love this place!

I have been going to Conti at least once a week since I moved to the neighborhood 2 years ago. The deli is great.  The subs are a great value - cheap as Subway and NO comparison.  The classic Italian is always good, but I am partial to the fresh mozza with sun dried tomatoes.  Great selection of sides to go along with your sandwich. We had an antipasto platter on Thanksgiving and it was delicious & reasonably priced. As a neighborhood resident, it is also a great place to pop in & pick up groceries.  They have fresh bread delivered everyday - rolls, french loaves, and big Italian loaves.  They always have all of the ingredients for any Italian meal - imported pasta & tomatoes, olive oils, balsamic, wine, etc.  They have great impulse buys here & there too - like fresh figs in season and lots of imported sweets.  And the freezer case has really tasty options as well if you don't want to cook yourself.

5 stars for the sandwiches alone.  I can only manage the small size, but it's a full meal.  Yummy turkey, peppers and all sorts of goodies on warm fresh bread. I should give them 1 star for the amount of money they trick me into spending on all the yummy goodies on their shelves.  Every time I run in I pick up the necessities I need to make dinner, I end up with 10 other things that I had no intention of buying, but now need desperately.  Also, they have orangina in the can! Yum!

Having not paid my meter, I spent no more than 4 minutes browsing through this place.  But I quickly ran through the store, purchased a few items, and headed home.  I bought a full pound of fresh meat and cheese ravioli along with a pound of meat sauce.  $10 was enough to feed both my brother and I for dinner which worked out well. The real standout was the price of the canned tomatoes.  $6.89 + tax for a giant 90 oz can of D.O.P. certified san marzano tomatoes.  My jaw hit the floor.  I've been to numerous other specialty shops and some charge as much as $5 or $6 for a 35 oz can.  Needless to say, I bought 2 of them.  I'll be back to try some more options from the deli counter and pick up a few more grocery items.  My 4 minute trip was definitely not long enough!

MAMA Mia..... Conte where have you been all my life???? I love this place for sandwiches for pasta for orangina for groceries. I lOVE CONTE.  Itsa BUUUUUTTTTIFUL THING! YOU NEEDA TO TRYA THISA PLACA... DONT BE A STUNAADA!!

I love small, ethnic grocery stores. Thai, Italian, Japanese, Middle Eastern, and so on and so on... they're all so much more fun than your regular food-shopping experience- and I don't get to them nearly enough. I especially love THIS little ethnic grocery store and long-time local business. From what I recall, it's been around since the '40's, so obviously I can't be the only one that thinks they're doing something right. Conte Di Savoia is authentic (I overheard a number of Italian-speaking customers) and the deli and sandwiches are fresh, delicious, and a better price and quality than what you get at most sandwich shops, as is much of what they sell beyond the deli. There are all sorts of goodies that are almost impossible to find outside of a place like this, and browsing the aisles is almost as fun as browsing rare pieces of jewelry and accessories at a boutique (but only if you like that sort of thing, which I do). But really, the cheeses, breads, desserts, even condiments are all delicious. Apparently so are the Italian meats (this according to my brother, picky eater and chef extraordinaire, who also said they are much cheaper than where he usually buys them). However, my veggie-loving self can't give testament to whether that's true or not. But I'd trust him if I were you. Oh, there is also plenty of indoor seating, as well as a few tables outside. It's fun to watch when the old Italian men congregate at the outside tables to chat and argue. They seem as if they've probably been doing this for most of their lives and it's nice to see that even though much of the area has changed in more recent years, some things never do. But, if the grumpy old men bother you or you can't find a seat but want to eat outside, it's also nice to eat on a bench at the mini-park about a quarter of a block East. There's even a DiMaggio statue to gaze at if you need just a little bit more Italian in your life :)

This place carries specialty items that are so hard to find.  San Bitter, panna, monini olive oil, speck and pancetta, all staples in my pantry that I can't find anywhere else.   The staff at the register is really helpful and will carry your bags to your car, sometimes without even asking.   My husband loves their sweet sausage and sandwiches.   It isn't exactly beautiful on the inside but it's solid and if they ever went out of business I'd be lost.

this place is amazing. you can get a little shopping done and then peruse they're deli and get a huge delicious sandwich for a great deal. seriously, even if you're not super hungry, you cannot go wrong with the italian sub. choose your strength of peppers and enjoy! they have some tables inside for eating there.

Conti is as good as it gets for old-style Italian sandwiches. As for the business, it is an "anchor" business that opened in the mid-1980s as Little Italy began to go through a Renaissance. I am a regular (usually 2-5 times a week) and have ordered almost all of their sandwiches and most of their sides. Invariably, they are of the highest quality and the "small" is enough for any average eater. The best part about Conti is that it won't run you anymore, and probably less, than comparable fast food. In addition to the sandwiches they offer a great assortment of italian delicacies and wines, and even sell bocci ball sets. Overall,  Conti is always worth a stop for lunch.

On one hand, it has been my go to location for Italian staples. On the other hand, they recently sold me lesser pancetta and lesser romano than they used to carry. In late spring, you can buy fresh potted basil. They used to have great hard cheeses and an unbelievable pancetta.  Must be the economy.

Yum! Great fresh sandwiches at the deli counter.  Choose your own freshly cut meats and cheeses for a great lunch experience.  Smalls are pretty good sized, but the regular is a big lunch.  Great selection of drinks and chips.  Good selection of pastas and other italian food stuffs.  Macaroni salad is also super good and fresh from the deli. I've taken people there before, and they all say they prefer it over Subway any day!

Turkey provolone was piled high with goodies and for around $4, that $5 footlong can suck it!  They also had a nice little selection of beverages in the refrigerator section and I took notice of a bunch of Italians wines scattered throughout along with other Italian imports. I would love to go back but I wouldn't make a special trip since I can find most of the same items at Caputos. Beware of the communal towel in the bathroom...creeepy.

quaint little grocery/deli with an interesting assortment of items (I would have bought some stuff but I didn't want to carry it around walking).  We were eating there so I got a veggie sandwich (artichoke and eggplant) with sweet peppers.  It was pretty drenched in oil but was tasty.  The cole slaw was over-mayo'd but was pretty good, too.  I also got a Berghoff root beer. If I ate meat I probably would have appreciated it more, but if I were in the neighborhood I might pop in again for a sub and an Italian soda to eat on the patio in the sun.

i popped in here today... it is a great place!  a good selection of imported italian items.. it looked like they had lasagna ready to go for you to cook at home, which i will be trying one day! I had a salami and provolone sandwhich, it was good for what it was.. beats going to potbelly

I've lived in the neighborhood since before Conte moved to Taylor.  Been there jillions of times and have loved it always.  The subs are the greatest with mayo, mustard, oil and vinegar, and Hot Peppers.  Very high quality ingredients. If you're having a crowd you can't beat Anna's homemade lasagnas.  The meat is my favorite, but all are good.  So easy, and you'll get rave reviews, and you don't even have to tell them you didn't make it.

I love this place.  The deli selection is good, and the grocery has a good variety of Italian products.  This is one of the best Italian delis I've been to in Chicago, but it doesn't compare to the ones in St. Louis, Boston or New York--hence the four rating.

This is a really cute store complete with a fresh sandwich deli.  I love walking by in the summertime and seeing their giant basil plants for sale - just walk by, close your eyes and smell the sweet, sweet basil... Their sandwiches are good - pretty good - I tend to order the Hot Italian Sandwich (I wish I could order a Hot Italian Man there...) and they do a good job.  The meats are fresh and good seasoning. My only complaint is their bread.  Maybe I'm just so obsessed with the bread they use at Bari Foods that this sandwich here is just subpar. Take some time to shop around the store to discover all their homemade items in the frozen section or browse through their great selection of imported olive oil, sardines, anchovies and pastas! This place is worth a stop if you're in the neighborhood!
stopped in here for an Italian sub today, they've got this Chicken Vegetable Stew that is OMG soooo GOOD!!!!   Enjoy your nearest deli today!

good for sandwiches, WAY better than Grand daddys down the street as far as selection, the service is prompt, seating is limited. would not go out of my way to go here but i work around the corner so i come like 2wice a month.

We stopped by this place after searching the neighborhood for lunch spots.  Order the Italian subs here!  I had an Italian sub, and he had a salami & cheese sub.  They were both really delicious.  We ate in the shop, which is also a small store for imported Italian goods.  You can buy deli meats and cheeses here, as well.  It's a great place for a quick, satisfying lunch.

holy shit holy shit holy shit holy shit I'm moving into the neighborhood in a couple of weeks and I am flat out fucking ecstatic to be so close to this place.  I really cannot wait to explore everything. The sandwiches are pure bliss.

When I moved into the West Loop, I figured that with Taylor street right there, I'd be going to a different Italian grocery store & deli counter every week.  Well, as those of you who have walked through Little Italy already know, this is sadly not the case.  Conte Di Savoia is it.  However it seems like the lack of competition has not effected the quality of their deli meats.  There are some fantastic salamis & great proscutio here.  We also buy our hunks of Parmesan from their deli (no green can of pregrated cheese dust in my fridge), as well as their olives.  I've found the prices for these deli items to be across the board cheaper than what you would pay at Dominick's or Jewel, & with a much wider selection.  The sandwiches are also terrific. I had a romantic idea of finding some great olive oil in a cool can that my friends could never find at the supermarket, but I'm not willing to make such a substantial investment here.  All of their grocery items seem pretty expensive.  I've only actually purchased one item that was not behind the deli counter.  It was instant espresso powder (not for drinking, but for adding to chocolate baked goods) & I have not been able to find it anywhere else. I've been to Conte Di Savoia several times now & I've always encountered very friendly people working behind the counter.  The old folks who hang out there are always friendly too.  It's a nice mix of students & some old Italians that you don't get down the block at Starbucks.

Conti di Sovoia has a great selection of cured meats and cheeses, and they make a killer sandwich. I love there dried FIGs, go FIGure and the wide aray of authentic Italian goods they carry. I can't make it out the door without my large Itailan sub with hot peppers. Yum.
The cramped lay out of this grocery store made my sandwich taste bad...just kidding...this place has the BEST PROSCIUTTO SANDWICH IN THE CITY Free Parking in the back alley, you're welcome
Great cheap sandwiches!  The grocery items are a little pricey, oh well.  I was at a party catered by Conte Di Savoia and everything was wonderful!  Good espresso too.  Try the deli salads.

Noooooo, come on, this cant be for real?  I'm the only one giving this place a lower rating?  Wow, either you folks have brainwashed into thinking "If its on Taylor it must be Italian!" or you all set the bar pretty low to begin with.   First off, the layout is atrocious.  Dont get me started.  Its awful, and the little room BEHIND the deli counter is a totally stupid idea.  I couldnt tell if that was a work area for employees only or not, until these two guys off the street just sauntered back there.  If you want something to drink though, that's where you have to go.  Also the whole checkout counter area is a ridiculous waste of space.   Everything is so overpriced I had dirt on my chin from my jaw hitting the floor so many times.  $9.50 for a jar of pasta sauce?  $8 for a bag of dried pasta?  Look folks you do the math.  Thats $17.50  -  a plate of good HOMEMADE pasta and sauce will run you $10 at any restaurant on that street - and you dont have to do the dishes afterwards.   Cannoli was...runny?  THAT'S never happened before!  Yikes. And if you dont get hot peppers on your sandwich at the deli, you are getting nothing better than Subway.  Shredded lettuce, pink tomatoes and salty deli meat - all for $4.50 for a small.     But hey, I can sympathize - pickins are mighty slim on Taylor for Italian groceries.  I guess if that is all you have offered its going to seem like a great place.  Dont be fooled - its really not.

This little deli is nothing short of excellent!! Whether you need to pick up fresh Italian breads or other special food or need a quick lunch Conte Di Savoia has it. The prices are very reasonable, in particular the fresh bread can often be found for cheaper than supermarket prices. Highly recommend.

I used to work down the street and I still think about their tasty subs! This is a great little Italian import shop. Some great meats, cheeses, canned goods, pastas, bread, espressos and if you can't find it, just ask, they probably have it hidden.
