You will also find many of the older locals hanging out here, sipping on an espresso, commenting on life, reading an Italian paper, feel free to say hi to them. Just like the rest of the staff their pretty friendly.
Get here for all your gen-yew-whine Italian supplies.  Yay! We stopped here for espresso in little cups. I like the ex-marines guy at the counter, he's cranky.

Best Italian Sub in the city.  On a GREAT street with various other "lunch" places, this should be your only stop (especially if you're thinking of hitting the Potbelly's).  Fantastic market too, fresh meats/cheeses and espresso.  Do yourself a favor, grab a sub with everything, a cannoli and some coffee and enjoy!  A sad rarity that it's one of a kind.

Sadly, this is the only proper Italian Deli in the city.  Not that the food is bad, but I wish there were more.  Anyway, great subs as expected, but I've got a ridiculously high bar for pasta and everything else there, so my opinion isn't good for most of you on the rest.

i have had several items for parties i have hosted and the guests always rave about the goods from Conte Di Savoia.....the peppers n sausage were out of this world and the sandwich platters.....im getting hungry just thinking of them..everything was so fresh and flavorful...this place has pretty much EVERYTHING you need for italian cooking and lots of things you will not find in the "ethnic" aisle at Jewel or Dominicks....great staff and great outdoor seating to people watch....
Its like a grocery store and deli in one! I had the cheese sub, it was pretty good, I will have to go back and try the eggplant and artichoke one that Francesca is taking about!

I deeply miss my year living in Little Italy and this place, along with Mario's Italian Ice, is the main reason.  Their sandwiches are freakin' phenomenal and their cannolis are some of the best around.  I highly recommend you check this place out next time you're cruising Taylor Street, you won't be sorry.

This place has excellent sandwiches! Stop here for lunch! Also, if you need some Italian specialty groceries, this place is highly recommended. However, if you need to do a full-scale grocery run, this isn't quite the place. They have a nice selection of Italian wines and cheese, too.
Ok, this is a really neat place. Find novel Italian items. Only problem I have is the prices

another great little hidden gem i've been going to for years!  VERY authentic!  Fresh bread and fresh ingredients!   they have their own parking lot in the back, which is awesome in the Little Italy neighborhood where parking can be scarce.  Very cozy and friendly! Love the sandwiches and ethnic wines and foods available.   *I think you might want to stay away at lunchtime, as many UIC students and ppl. from the medical district flood this joint at that time.*

I'm from the east coast, where Italian delis are plentiful.  When I moved to Chicago, I was very dismayed at what passed for an "italian sub" here.  When it finally occurred to me to look in little italy for a real italian /hoagie/, I (1) smacked myself for not thinking of it sooner and (2) went to Conte di whatever for what ended up being the best hoagie I'd had since I ventured west.   (By the way, firefox's spell checker suggests "cagier" for "hoagie".  What's a cagier?  And what does it have to do with sandwiches?)

Lots of imported ingredients available for an Italian feast.    Their sandwiches are pretty good. Their house salad is a large and delicious combination of  salami, provolone, giardinera, artichoke, olives and lettuce, all liberally doused in olive oil, vinegar, and spices and accompanied by four slices of bread.  There are lots of other interesting pre-made items in the deli area that intrigue me, from fresh tortelini to squid salad, but I haven't tried them yet.    Their mini tomato foccaccia is pretty good too, it kind of grows on you until you realize you just ate a 4 pack of them in two days. The crowd is usually a mix of ages: senior citizens, college kids, and people on their lunch break. Worth a try.

This place has great sandwiches and salads!  Its an authentic italian deli so all their meat and veggies are fresh.  They've got cute outdoor seating and the staff is really friendly.  Plus they've got specialty groceries you can stock up on!

Conte's is an Italian  market with various groceries  and wine. But what they are known for are their sandwiches. The sandwiches are fresh and come with yummy macoroni salad. When the weather is nice, there are tables outside to eat at.
